newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-DEPORTIVO SET BACK WITH 2-1 DEFEAT AT TENERIFE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-DEPORTIVO SET BACK WITH 2-1 DEFEAT AT TENERIFE.

text.p: Deportivo Coruna saw their chances of taking Spain's second European Cup place fade on Saturday when they went down 2-1 at Tenerife, the club's first defeat since the arrival of coach Carlos Alberto Silva.
The result left Deportivo fourth, one point behind Real Betis and three behind Barcelona, who both play on Sunday.

In other games, bottom-placed Sevilla were held to a goalless draw by fellow strugglers Extremadura, while Valencia cracked in five goals in the opening 34 minutes of their match with Athletic Bilbao.
Brazilian forward Leandro struck twice, Gabriel Moya once and Argentine midfielder Ariel Ortega converted two penalties before Athletic hit back twice to leave the final score 5-2.
